column4: well - no, that wasn't how to create a menu - that was how to create a submenu i found
sweet - got the places control under control
anyone know how to add a folder to the "applications places system" menu?
or how to make it not show any of those?
right click > edit menus> new menu
that created a new submenu withing the applications or system folder
hmm not sure howto do that
thanks anyway. neither do i, heh
lemme check something out
right click on the panel ( emtpy space ) add to panel> scroll down some and add custom menu
sorry Menu Bar
ok maybe not
the custom menu bar adds the one i have on there already... yeah, looks like i'd have to recode the menu bar app
yeah I saw that after i told you
size?
hah, no - i meant like with a sledgehammer and $500 for a replacement or something. it's just fuzzy if i havn't had it on for like an hour. it'll go away
maybe just a regular hammer and many swings... it might be more satisfying.
3rd floor window always does the trick :)
have you heard of this though? It's an old flatscreen, and it's fuzzy until it "gets warm" or something.
no but I have heard of this in older flat screen tv's
strange... i jump into warsow and the "fuzziness" completely goes away.
then i quit out and it's back to fuzzy. i know if i sit around for an hour or so it'll gradually go away
